articles.title: Boxed in by shifting tariff rules, European shippers pause some U.S.-bound parcels - NPR
articles.description: New customs regulations take effect August 29, and many European postal agencies and companies say until new systems are set up they can't ship some goods. Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.
articles.content: Many European parcel companies including DHL, the Royal Mail, and the French and Spanish national post offices are temporarily suspending some shipments to the U.S., citing new U.S. tariff policies t… [+3371 chars]
